page.title: 12WAYFIELD FARM
page.content: We visited Wayfield Farm and talked to the owner. It is 134 acres large with another 5O acres rented at Fulking. The farm house is probably recorded in the original Domesday Book. It was also a coaching station 2OO years ago. Instead of horses and carts of years ago, today there are tractors costing Â£16,OOO each, trailers and cultivators at work. The farm specialises in Charelais beef cattle using a Charelais bull. Friesian cows are used to feed the calves. Cattle are sold at Haywards Heath market. In 194O a bullock fetched Â£9O, today Â£6OO. Then fertilisers cost less than Â£4O per ton now it is Â£18O. As well as the traffic thundering on the A23, belonging to the EEC has caused problems. For rearing a calf worth Â£18 the Government subsidy was Â£18. Now the calf costs Â£14O with no subsidy given.
